alert.note: Alert for Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 08 at 3:40AM EDT until October 08 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, Far Northern, and Penobscot Valley Maine, including the following areas, in Central Highlands Maine, Northern Penobscot. In Far Eastern Maine, Northern Washington and Southeast Aroostook. In Far Northern Maine, Northeast Aroostook. In Penobscot Valley Maine, Central Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Locally heavy rainfall will continue into Sunday morning before tapering off early this afternoon. Around additional 1 to 1.5 inches is expected. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
